CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 30, 1960, pg. 3 reads:" Vandalized Home Vs. Wrecked Home - The owner of these two homes in left photo, which are located in East Pittsburgh, hurried Tuesday morning to use paint remover to remove a large, neatly lettered sign painted on the sidewalk in front of them reading: "Keep Out, N--rs." In crayon, in four places on the doors, biased white vandals wrote the same message, smeared paint all over windows and an outside brick wall, threw a brick through one window and built a fire of rubbish on the sidewalk...-Harris Photo.""
TitMainTitle: Facade of row houses vandalized with light colored paint, broken window, and graffiti, 666 and 666 1/2 East Sycamore Street
